feed.title: CCSS
feed.subtitle: The website of the Carleton Computer Science Society, providing opportunities and resources for CS students to succeed

entry.title: CIO Summit Hackathon 2017
entry.content:
Alex Benay, Chief Information Officer (CIO) of the Government of Canada, is inviting you to apply to participate in the 2017 CIO Summit Hackathon. This hackathon will be a two-day brainstorming marathon where interdisciplinary teams will work together to solve problems or explore opportunities that the CIO’s have identified!

It will be a wonderful opportunity for participants to learn and network with the Government of Canada IT leaders, industry professionals and digital enthusiasts. At the end of the second day, teams will get an opportunity to showcase their “hacks” to GC IT leaders in a “Dragons’ Den” fashion.

Participation is not limited to the technically inclined; any person interested in strengthening Canada’s digital future is welcome to join. We believe this would be a valuable experience for students or faculty in the areas of business, political science, public affairs, communications, law, information technology, computer science, etc.

This event will be limited to 36 participants and will take place on June 26th and June 27th.

Register here!

It will be a wonderful opportunity for participants to learn and network with the Government of Canada IT leaders, industry professionals and digital enthusiasts. At the end of the second day, teams will get an opportunity to showcase their “hacks” to GC IT leaders in a “Dragons’ Den” fashion.
Participation is not limited to the technically inclined; any person interested in strengthening Canada’s digital future is welcome to join. entry.title: CUHacking Exec Applications Open
entry.content:
The CUHacking executive applications are now available. Role descriptions can be found in the Google Doc at the top of the application form. Roles that are available include:

  • Co-Leads (2)
  • Financial Director (1)
  • Sponsorship Lead (3)
  • Internal Director (2)
  • External Director (1)
  • Social Director (2)
  • Webmaster (2)
  • Logistics Director (2)

Applications will be open until April 30th.
entry.summary: The CUHacking executive applications are now available. Role descriptions can be found in the Google Doc at the top of the application form. Roles that are available include:

entry.title: UI Developer Co-op at Distill Mobile

link.title: UI Developer Co-op at Distill Mobile

entry.content:
Distill Mobile is seeking an Intermediate Web UI Developer (co-op) to work on client applications.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Contributing to existing mobile and web e-commerce applications developed for clients
  • Implementing web user interfaces using various technologies including but not limited to JavaScript, Ember, HTML5, JQuery and CSS3
  • Building adaptive page layouts
  • Reviewing, testing, and debugging application code
  • Maintaining and testing web applications
  • Performing other related duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Enrolled in 3rd or 4th year of a Bachelor’s degree or graduate degree in Computer Science or related discipline
  • Minimum 1 to 2 years of experience in developing web applications
  • Experience in developing cross-browser UIs for web applications using modern frameworks
  • Strong communication skills
  • Experience with Ruby On Rails or Node.js is a bonus
  • Experience with PostgreSQL or MySQL is a bonus
  • Experience with Android or iOS development is a bonus
  • Ability to finish projects on time, within budget and with high quality

Please reply Tom Murphy with your cover letter and resume to be considered for this role.
entry.summary:
Distill Mobile is seeking an Intermediate Web UI Developer (co-op) to work on client applications.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Contributing to existing mobile and web e-commerce applications developed for clients Implementing web user interfaces using various technologies including but not limited to JavaScript, Ember, HTML5, JQuery and CSS3 Building adaptive page layouts Reviewing, testing, and debugging application code Maintaining and testing web applications Performing other related duties as assigned

entry.title: Lockheed Martin is Hiring
entry.content:
They have tons of entry level positions available in Ottawa and other Canadian Cities!

Company Profile

Lockheed Martin is an American global aerospace, defense, security and advanced technologies company with worldwide interests. It was formed by the merger of Lockheed Corporation with Martin Marietta in March 1995.

Apply Here!
entry.summary: They have tons of entry level positions available in Ottawa and other Canadian Cities!

entry.title: GCTools Hackathon
entry.content:
You can participate virtually!

Register Here!
More Info…

What is hackathon?

A hackathon (also known as a hack day, hackfest or codefest) is a design sprint-like event in which computer programmers, designers, project managers and others involved in software development come together to develop a solution or prototype to solve an issue. Other participants often included in a hackathon are subject matter experts that collaborate intensively on software projects.

During the GCTools Hackathon, the teams are free to work on any fix or functionalities they wish. A list of current issues: bugs, enhancements request and a wish list of new features can be found on the GitHub repository of each project.

  • GCconnex
  • GCcollab
  • GCpedia

In addition, we identified the following challenges as areas we want to improve the GCTools:

  • Accessibility
  • Usability and User experience
  • Collaboration with open source communities
  • If your team has a different idea or a new feature concept, just add it to the GitHub issues!

Team Formation

Register to participate in the GCTools Hackathon. Don’t forget to join the group on GCconnex or GCcollab to start a discussion.

Participants are encouraged to form teams ahead of time. The GCTools team will also support team building by implementing and maintaining a team finder process.The GCTools Hackathon is open to everyone, including the federal, provincial/territorial public service as well as students and teachers from universities and colleges in Canada. Participants located in the National Capital Region can work together in the ISED Service Lab or work remotely from anywhere in Canada.

The GCTools Hackathon is not just for people who code; a diversity of skills, experience and ideas, contributing to a unified cause, will results in richer and more diverse outcomes.

Submissions

The best way to submit your work is through GitHub. By the end of the second day, Teams should:

  • Do a quick presentation to the judging panel
  • Create Pull request(s) on GitHub with their changes
  • Provide a URL to a description of their work
  • You can use a README file in a GitHub repository, GitHub pages or your own hosting
  • Be creative!

Register Here!
More Info…

entry.title: Global Technical Support Engineer at Aprel

link.title: Global Technical Support Engineer at Aprel

entry.content:
APREL Inc

Apply Here!

Job Description

APREL Inc, the Near-Field Systems specialist, offers leading measurement solutions, intelligent software and a comprehensive services practice. Our portfolio of measurement systems offers customers the ability to change the way they compete. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated manufacturers, design, government, and research and education organisations across the globe.

The candidate will provide APREL post-sales support to our customers for APREL’s current system portfolio as well as next generation solutions. This support includes commissioning, installation, diagnosing, testing and troubleshooting of complex issues including analysis of the logical configuration and operation of the users system and measurement applications.

Global Technical Support Engineer/Technologist will:

  • Troubleshoot APREL product problems and escalate to the proper level
  • Subject to the limitations of customers installed software and hardware, work to resolve APREL product issues/problems
  • Provide remote and telephone technical support for APREL’s system portfolio
  • Availability for after-hour phone support, and or pre-arranged after hours maintenance window support
  • Provide training and knowledge transfer to internal teams and customers on an as needed basis
  • Availability to travel, sometimes on short notice
  • Travel approximately 40%

Required Skills

  • Ability at defining and analyzing complex problems and being able to explain the details to others
  • Ability to diagnose, troubleshoot and debug complex system issues
  • Excellent customer service
  • Excellent organizational, interpersonal skills and problem solving skills
  • Team player. Must be able to work well in a collaborative team environment that promotes sharing of knowledge and experiences
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Knowledge of integrated systems
  • Knowledge of electronic and radio frequency test equipment (spectrum analysers, oscilloscopes etc)
  • Knowledge and understanding of robotic concepts

Required Experience

  • Extensive experience administering systems based on windows platforms
  • Software programming skills
  • Experience in providing technical support
  • Experience of operating test equipment
  • Scripting, JAVA , basic code understanding
  • Bachelor's Degree in Engineering or Computer Science
  • Desired a minimum 1-2 years’ experience in supporting/deploying/systems
  • APREL will consider a graduate who can demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the above requirements.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location: Kanata, ON

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Customer Service: 1 year
  • Technical Support: 1 year

Required license or certification:

  • Drivers License

Apply Here!

entry.title: Full Time Systems Engineer at Aprel

link.title: Full Time Systems Engineer at Aprel

entry.content:
APREL Inc

Apply Here!

Company Profile

APREL Inc, the Near-Field Systems specialist, offers leading measurement solutions, intelligent software and a comprehensive services practice. Our portfolio of measurement systems offers customers the ability to change the way they compete. Our solutions form the foundation of many of the largest, most reliable and sophisticated manufacturers, design, government, and research and education organisations across the globe.

The candidate will be required to offer ideas, program and review existing code along with develop new and unique applications for use in our automated system solutions.

Experience Considered

  • Develop and maintain existing software applications
  • Evaluate complex mathematical problems and provide solutions for integration
  • Program in C#, C++ or Java
  • Evaluate existing code and improve/implement changes
  • Program hardware such as spectrum analysers, signal generators or other types of test equipment for use in automated systems
  • GUI (graphical user interface) design and programming within 3D environment
  • VRML programming with Cortona SDK in a C# application with the following properties:
    - Based on existing APREL libraries and 3D models
    - Work with team members to design graphical user interfaces for large scale applications
    • 1st stage is to develop use cases based on existing systems;
    • 2nd stage is to implement;
    • 3rd stage is to apply developed look/feel to different internal applications;
  • Work with team members to improve and maintain existing install packages
  • Software Testing
    - Able to design application based test plans to validate builds
    - Ability to complete test plans
    - Utilize automated testing software (Test Complete) to aid in development cycles

Experience and Knowledge Required

  • Under-graduate degree in computing science or systems engineering
  • Ability to create communication programs with test equipment through GPIB or TCPIP
  • Object oriented programming (Java / C#)
  • Software design process from concept to deployment
  • Strong communication skills in English both written and orally
  • Mathematical software skills applied to modeling, ability to analyze or calculate numeric, symbolic or geometric data

Desirable Experience

  • Knowledge of 3D graphics and visual development, robotics, artificial intelligence Strong understanding of usability principles
  • Strong sense of style and look-feel
  • Hardware interfacing PC hardware knowledge
  • Software testing
  • Knowledge of DENSO robotics systems
  • Understanding of test equipment and communications protocols such as Agilent/Keysight, Anritsu or R&S
  • National Instrument driver development and protocols such as IVI
  • Repository maintenance, etc
  • Ability to program robotics systems such as 5/6 axis articulated systems, knowledge of DENSO robotics systems is a significant advantage

Additional Information

Preference will be given to those who can demonstrate knowledge, provide examples of work and show quantifiable evidence of achievements within the described role.

New graduates will be considered.

Applicants must include a cover letter with brief details of their applicability to the job and a current resume.

Job Type: Full-time

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • Mathematics: 3 years
  • Systems Engineer: 2 years
  • Computer Science: 2 years

Apply Here!

entry.title: CCSS Elections
entry.content:
The CCSS elections are coming up!

If you are looking for an opportunity to have a leadership role in the Computer Science Society, you should think about running as a director. There are four positions that you can run for:

  • Vice President
  • Vice President Social
  • Vice President Academics
  • Treasurer

More details about the responsibilities of these roles are found in the nomination form.

To be nominated, you need to receive three signatures for other Computer Science students OR one signature from a current director of the CCSS. Each person may only give one nomination.

Once you have completed your form, please either drop off your form in the CCSS office or email Matt Diener at matt.diener@ccss.carleton.ca with a scanned copy.

The deadline to complete your form is this Friday, March 3, 2017.

Nomination Form
entry.summary: The CCSS elections are coming up!

entry.title: Space Apps Challenge
entry.content:
Ottawa, prepare for liftoff!

The NASA International Space Apps Challenge is an intense 48-hour global weekend hackathon for developers, designers, engineers, entrepreneurs, astronomers and enthusiasts. Along with nearly 200 cities around the world, Ottawa teams will form and build products and prototypes against NASA-designed challenges that leverage spacecraft, celestial and science data.

This FREE event will run from Friday evening, April 28 to Sunday, April 30. If you are interested and likely to go, please register so we can determine how much space we need. That also helps us organize snacks and other logistics to ensure you have a great time.

Find out more, including how to register, at Space Apps Ottawa.
